intro: Cieca glabrata, commonly known as the smooth cieca, is a lesser-known plant species with unique botanical characteristics. It is a herbaceous plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate regions. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are smooth and lack any hairy or glandular structures. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, usually greenish-white in color, and it produces capsule-like fruits containing numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Cieca glabrata is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation and biodiversity.
